title: US and UK militaries launch airstrikes on Houthi rebels in Yemen
summary: The United States and Britain struck Houthi rebels over the Iran-backed group's attacks on shipping in the Red Sea. US President Joe Biden said he 'will not hesitate' to order further action if needed.

title: Macron replaces foreign, culture, labor ministers in reshuffle that shifts government to the right
summary: The reshuffle followed the appointment this week of 34-year-old Gabriel Attal as prime minister.

title: Former Sarkozy minister Rachida Dati named new culture minister
summary: Paris's 7th arrondissement mayor and former justice minister under Nicolas Sarkozy will replace Rima Abdul Malak.

title: Renewable energy: 'The rest of the world is completely dependent on China'
summary: Global production capacity in this sector has risen by 50% since 2022. Economic journalist Philippe Escande attributes this growth to government policies and the affordability of installations, especially in the China-dominated photovoltaic industry.

title: Pyongyang now views South Koreans not as 'compatriots' but as 'enemies'
summary: Amidst North Korea's shelling in the Yellow Sea, a shift in Kim Jong-un's policy toward Seoul is taking shape.

title: NBA in Paris: Donovan Mitchell scores a season-high 45 points to lead the Cavs past the Nets
summary: The Cleveland Cavaliers on Thursday evening easily defeated the Brooklyn Nets 111-102 in the third NBA regular season game held in the French capital.

title: Al Jazeera rejects Israeli claims that journalists killed were 'terror operatives'
summary: The Israeli army labeled the two journalists killed in Gaza as 'members of terrorist organizations,' a claim Al Jazeera strongly denied on Thursday as 'false' and 'misleading.'

title: Ecuador President Daniel Noboa declares war on gangs
summary: Noboa has deployed the army in response to violence by criminal groups, which has left 14 people dead since Monday.

title: South Africa says Israel aims at 'destruction of Palestinian life'
summary: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) has been asked by South Africa to consider whether Israel is committing genocide against the Palestinians in Gaza.

title: Hunter Biden pleads not guilty to tax evasion charges
summary: President Joe Biden's son pleaded not guilty Thursday to federal tax charges filed after the collapse of a plea deal that could have spared him the spectacle of a criminal trial during the 2024 election campaign.

title: German far-right party leaders planned mass deportation laws with neo-Nazis
summary: German investigative website Correctiv has revealed that Alternative for Germany (AfD) leaders met with neo-Nazi movement figures to plan 'remigration' laws to relocate 'unassimilated' Germans to North Africa.

title: Polish president to pardon jailed ex-lawmakers
summary: Polish police had arrested prominent Law and Justice (PiS) politicians inside the presidential palace in Warsaw on Tuesday in a day of unprecedented political theatre.

title: Christie's withdrawal narrows competition in US Republican primary
summary: The former governor of New Jersey, who did everything in his power to oppose Donald Trump, didn't want to be responsible for splitting votes.

title: Fei-Fei Li, discreet pioneer of artificial intelligence
summary: Strangely absent from a New York Times ranking of key AI figures, this Chinese-born American researcher has nonetheless worked to exponentially increase computer learning capabilities. Today, she is committed to making technology work for humanity.

title: 'King of kitsch' Henry Rox and his delirious garden
summary: Henry Rox, a German Jew exiled to the United States in the 1930s, immortalized his surreal sculptures of bananas, lemons, leeks, asparagus and onions. After falling into oblivion, his work was rediscovered in 2020 by the German collector Wolfgang Vollmer.

title: Georgia court to rule over fate of former president Saakashvili
summary: Judges are to decide whether the former president, who has been imprisoned since his return to Georgia in 2021, should be released or have his sentence postponed on health grounds. Findings of a medical report established he was 'poisoned.'

title: Post Office scandal: UK government at last shows interest in the victims
summary: It took the broadcast of a mini-series in early January to raise public awareness of the scale of this affair, in which at least 800 post office managers were unfairly accused of fraud.

title: Scandal grips Georgia after icon of Stalin discovered in prominent church
summary: In the former Soviet republic with a pro-European population, the representation is seen as a victory for Russian propaganda.

title: In Russian-occupied Crimea: 'War is bound to happen here'
summary: Residents of the Ukrainian peninsula, annexed by Moscow in 2014, share how the 2022 invasion changed their daily lives. Acts of resistance are on the rise.

title: Paris 2024: The uncertain economic impact of the Olympic Games
summary: Although recent studies are lacking, some experts and observers predict significant consequences while others foresee a more moderate impact.
